bibl.title: Letter to Carolyn H. Booth from [Caroline Latimer?], December 6, 1907

div1.p: The writer acknowledges the receipt of a letter concerning Kissinger's pension increase. Kelly awaits instructions for further assistance.

div1.head: Letter to Carolyn H. Booth from [Caroline Latimer?], December 6, 1907
div1.p:
Dr. Kelly desires
me to acknowledge your
letter of recently received,
and to thank you for
your continued interest
in Mr. Kissinger. Dr.
Kelly has had some
correspondence on the sub-
ject of the pension with
AC
Ki
Mr. Edwin Denby the Con-
gressman from Michegan
who has been most
warmly interested. Mr.
Denby suggested that
the best plan would
be to for him to intro-
duce the bill in the
house together with Mr.
Mudd, the Congressman
from Maryland who
has offered to help at
the same time that Mr.
AC
Ki
Mason did so in the Senate.
Mr. Pinckney Whyte, our Senator
would give Mr. Mason has
offered to help. As Kissinger
already has a pension I
suppose it is not necessary
to for obtain all the papers
relating to it again,

If you will so kind
as to let Dr. Kelly know
what steps shall be now
taken he will be much
obliged. N
